snippet: The former president flew home from the South American country on Sunday after falling ill, the Carter Center, his nonprofit organization, said.
abstract: Former Pres Jimmy Carter's nonprofit organization Carter Center says he ended election-monitoring trip to Guyana early and flew home after becoming sick.
lead_paragraph: The former president flew home from the South American country on Sunday after falling ill, the Carter Center, his nonprofit organization, said.

headline.main: After Illness, Former President Jimmy Carter Ends Trip Monitoring Guyanese Election
headline.print_headline: After Illness, Carter Ends Trip Monitoring Guyana Election
